title.narrative: EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, national and sub-national capacity to provide access to quality early childhood development services, especially for the most vulnerable children, is increased., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Early Learning, Education â€“ General, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Learning Outcomes, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Increased use of services and strengthened good practices for the fulfilment of young child's rights to health, nutrition, protection and school readiness, particularly for marginalised children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, national and sub-national capacity to provide access to quality early childhood development services,especially for the most vulnerable children, is increased.

description.narrative: UNICEF Mongolia&39;s technical support and advocacy led to a successful amendment of the Law on Pre-school Education with inclusion of norms for equal opportunity for all children and free-of-charge Early Childhood Education for most disadvantaged children. The amended law will benefit approximately 300,000 children once implemented in January 2017. | Status:Met | As-of Date:11/01/2017
